data.title: School Leadership
data.meta_site_name: Stevenson School - Day & Boarding School in Monterey Peninsula, CA
data.text:
Boise, ID

Trustee 2006–2020, Emeritus Trustee from 2020-present

BA, Magna Cum Laude, University of Utah

President of the Boise Philharmonic Foundation, Trustee of the College of Idaho, and National Trustee (past chair) of the National Symphony Orchestra

Related service: Board chairman of the Treasure Valley Family YMCA, and board member of the Boise Art Museum, The Idaho Humane Society, Saint Alphonsus Regional Medical Center, the Boise State University Athletic Association and the Idaho Community Foundation; commissioner on the Idaho Committee for the United States Holocaust Museum.

Awards and Honors: Saint Alphonsus Regional Medical Center’s Distinguished Citizen Award, the Boise Metro Chamber of Commerce Community Service Award and the Esther Simplot Lifetime Achievement Award for Support of the Boise Philharmonic

Pebble Beach, CA

Trustee from 1995-2017, Emeritus Trustee from 2019-present

Honorary Doctorate of Business Administration and Degree in Hospitality Management, Johnson & Wales University

Chairman and CEO, Cannery Row Company

Chairman and CEO, Inns of Monterey

Chairman and Co-Founder, The Sardine Factory Restaurant

Related service: Serves on the boards of the Panetta Institute, Rancho Cielo Youth Campus, and the Monterey Wine Educational Foundation. Former chairman and president of the National Restaurant Association, former chairman of the National Restaurant Association Educational Foundation, former trustee of the Community Hospital of the Monterey Peninsula.

San Francisco, CA

Trustee since 1981; Board Chair 1989–1993 and 2004–2018; President of the Stevenson Alumni Association 1977 – 1981

BA, Cornell University

Principal for Design, Hornberger + Worstell

Related service: Past chairman for the Design Awards Committee of the AIA California Council, chair of the Architecture and Design Forum of the San Francisco Museum of Modern Art, chair AIA Capital Forum, director of AIA San Francisco Chapter, director of the AIA California Council and chair of the AIACC Task Force on CEQA reform, past trustee of the Ethel Walker School in Simsbury, Connecticut, and past trustee and board chair of the Town School for Boys San Francisco

Portland, OR

Trustee since 1993

Alumni Association President from 1988 to 1993

BS, Anthropology (with distinction), Stanford University

M.Ed. and Ed.D. in Higher Education Administration, University of Massachusetts at Amherst

Past president and CEO of the Boys and Girls Club of Monterey County; vice president of student affairs and professor of higher education at University of Southern California (USC)

Related service: Dean of Students, Stanford University; Commissioner of the Western Association of Senior Colleges and Universities

Awards and honors: Emeritus vice president, USC; married to Bishop Diana Akiyama, Episcopal Diocese of Oregon

Monterey, California

Trustee Since 2019

Attended California State University Long Beach

Ron is the president and CEO of the Boys and Girls Club of Monterey County. He has worked in various leadership roles at the Club since joining in 1992, including overseeing construction of the Harden Youth Center Clubhouse in Salinas in 2003. He’s a former NFL player (wide receiver) who played five seasons with the Philadelphia Eagles.

Related Service: He has served as a trustee for United Way, All Saints’ Day School, Monterey Peninsula College Foundation, and the Village Project.

Sacramento, CA

Trustee since 1993

BA, Political Science, Claremont McKenna College

JD, University of the Pacific, McGeorge School of Law

Senior partner and member of the firm’s management committee at Nielsen, Merksamer, Parrinello, Gross & Leoni

Related service: Current board member California Chamber of Commerce; founder and past Chair of State Law Resources, Inc.; Board of Governors of the Hoover Institution on War, Revolution and Peace at Stanford University and the Rose Institute of State and Local Government at Claremont McKenna College; Board of Directors of the Governor’s Residence Foundation, the California Museum, and the California Musical Theatre; Board of Directors of the Public Policy Institute of California (PPIC)
